purpose: Factory that creates and manages AI provider instances (OpenAI or Claude) based on configuration settings
userVisibleActions: Switches between different AI providers (OpenAI or Claude) for generating responses
Ensures only configured AI providers are available for use
Maintains consistent AI provider throughout the session unless configuration changes
developerVisibleActions: Provides a centralized way to obtain AI provider instances without creating duplicates
Returns the currently configured AI provider based on user settings
Validates which AI providers have valid API keys and configuration
Lists all AI providers that are properly configured and ready to use
Maintains singleton instances of each provider to avoid redundant initialization

keyFunctions.name: getProvider
keyFunctions.desc: Returns the AI provider instance for a specific provider type (openai or claude)

keyFunctions.name: getCurrentProvider
keyFunctions.desc: Returns the AI provider that is currently set in user configuration
keyFunctions.outputs: ILLMProvider instance of the configured provider

keyFunctions.name: isProviderConfigured
keyFunctions.desc: Checks if a specific AI provider has valid configuration and API keys
keyFunctions.outputs: boolean indicating if provider is ready to use

keyFunctions.name: getConfiguredProviders
keyFunctions.desc: Returns a list of all AI providers that are properly configured
keyFunctions.outputs: Array of LLMProvider types that are configured

intent: Provides a centralized factory pattern for creating and managing AI provider instances, ensuring proper initialization, configuration validation, and singleton behavior to avoid duplicate provider instances while supporting multiple AI backends.
